author: sky.cactus
content: Has anyone spent much time thinking about how to build a layer 2 censorship resistant ecommerce payment platform that doesn't require a huge amount of complexity for people doing integrations?

author: sky.cactus
content: I believe at the moment if you wanted to build a censorship resistant ecommerce platform each client would have to run their own Ethereum node, or at least subscribe to something like Infura or QuikNode.  Is there a system design that could be implemented today that would make this not necessary?  Even if you accept Infura/QuikNode, is it possible/reasonable to build a L2 ecommerce payment platform that doesn't require the user to run their own L2 servers?

author: sky.cactus
content: Paying for stuff online with ETH and paying $10 in transaction fees is not fun, but I also recognize that the vast majority of ecommerce apps out there don't have the skillset/ability to build out/operate/maintain all of the infrastructure necessary for a payment platform.

author: protolambda
content: Bots, they swarm lots of other crypto servers I'm in too, can't do much about it, we tried

author: treyzania
content: Not sure if this is the right place to go for this but I heard there was some work to coordinate a RSA trusted setup ceremony using the Diogenes construction at some point later this year and I was interested in getting involved
